comments.body: Are you sure the ``onchange`` listener has to be required for all components by default?

This interface is used in `Saturation`, `Alpha` and `Hue` common components and after checking the source code it seems they all require `onClick` handler specified. I created and [issue in their repo](https://github.com/casesandberg/react-color/issues/327) to make the handler optional. Right now the check if property has been provided as a function is not present. Not specifying `onClick` will cause errors in all of the components.

Here is source code reference:

- `Saturation` [source code](https://github.com/casesandberg/react-color/blob/master/src/components/common/Saturation.js#L10-L25)
- `Alpha` [source code](https://github.com/casesandberg/react-color/blob/master/src/components/common/Alpha.js#L12-L15)
- `Hue` [source code](https://github.com/casesandberg/react-color/blob/master/src/components/common/Hue.js#L10-L13)
